history.content:
<md>"I [...] was wondering if it would be okay to take 16A the first semester of sophomore year and 16B the second semester of sophomore year."

Thats a fine plan. Sophomores who sign up for 16A and B using phase 1 units will be in good shape.
For COE students who come in knowing their major, it makes sense to take these classes in first year but in L&S the model has generally been for students to explore a # of potential interests before committing to a major and so taking these classes in year two makes sense/is inevitable.

(It is, however, not a new policy: see  https://piazza.com/class/hyq0br1u3kx7dg?cid=15920 )</md>

Hello,

I was just asking for advice for what courses to take next semester and sophomore year.

I have read about the new policy that EECS 16AB and was wondering if it would be okay to take 16A the first semester of sophomore year and 16B the second semester of sophomore year. I was just asking because the website below states that only a small number of seats will be reserved for second year students.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/faqs/getting-into-ee-classes#lower

I would have taken 16A this semester but it collides with Physics 5B. Would it be best if I take Math 54 as a substitute for 16A and study circuits independently?

Thanks so much in advance for the help.
history.subject: EECS16AB Enrollment Advice
